author: Staff Reporter
text:
The district Congress unit has demanded unveiling of Kamaraj statue in the city.

During the road widening of the Salem – Ulundurpet National Highway, the statue of Kamaraj in Erumapalayam was removed.

Later in 2011, four members of the Congress party purchased a land along the highway and installed the statue.

However, when Tamil Manila Congress was formed, two members of the Congress party joined the new party.

Dispute prevailed between the members of the two parties as both claimed rights over the statue.

Cases were filed by both the parties in the court. Recently, both the parties decided to withdrew the case in the court.

However, people unveiled the statue which was later covered by the police.

The police said that since a case was pending in the court, unveiling the statue would not be permitted.

Later, both the parties withdrew the case.

On Monday, S.B. Meganathan, president, Salem Urban District Congress Committee, came to the Collectorate to submit petition to the Collector.
title: Congress demands unveiling of Kamaraj statue
